definition: to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
erhua variant of 倒霉蛋[dao3 mei2 dan4]

sentences.english: The poor unfortunate had starved to death .
sentences.chinese: 这个可怜的倒霉蛋是饿死的。

sentences.english: At first, Chan seems to be a pathetic patsy to Tuckers aggression.
sentences.chinese: 起初，成龙像是个老受塔克欺负的倒霉蛋。

sentences.english: The first one to be killed was No. ?
sentences.chinese: 第一个被杀的倒霉蛋是？

sentences.english: At first, Chan seems to be a hapless patsy to Tucker's bullying.
sentences.chinese: 起初，成龙像是个老受塔克欺负的倒霉蛋。

definition: erhua variant of 倒霉蛋[dao3 mei2 dan4]
to have bad luck/to be out of luck
sb who sacrifices himself/sacrificial victim/sb who is expendable
dog's leg/fig. one who follows a villain/henchman/hired thug
household dish, implement or furniture/domestic animal/(coll.) guy/chap/weapon
prisoner that awaits execution/convict sentenced to death/someone on death row
